fields.fieldDescription: N/A
The name of the deal.
The alias name for the deal.
"The Deal Tracking Number, a control number providing another way of uniquely identifying the deal."
The global deal proposed commitment amount (requested by the borrower prior to deal close).
Indicates whether or not bills for this deal are consolidated.
Indicates whether or not this deal complies with the Community Reinvestment Act.
Indicates whether or not the deal is a highly leveraged transaction (HLT).
Indicates whether or not access to the deal is restricted to specific users.
"Indicates whether or not the deal is eligible for ""Shared National Credit"" reporting."
"The Reference ID optionally assigned to a deal that is eligible for ""Shared National Credit"" reporting."
"Indicates whether or not ""reserve adjusted rates"" apply to this deal."
The code identifying the LS2 Client Bank (the purchaser of LS2).
Timestamp from when this row was created.
Timestamp from when this row was last updated.
User ID that created this row.  This is a foreign key to VLS_USER_PROFILE.UPT_UID_USERID.
User ID that last updated this row.  This is a foreign key to VLS_USER_PROFILE.UPT_UID_USERID.
The deal department code.
"The deal's performing status, indicating whether or not the Admin Fees defined for this deal are accruing or amortizing, as applicable."
Indicates whether or not the deal is a Closed Non-Host Bank Deal.  This field is not maintained and should be removed from the database.
The deal's selling stage code.
Indicates whether or not a guarantee exists at the deal level.
Indicates whether or not the deal is active.
"Indicates whether or not the deal is in the ,'early discussion,' stage.  If so, sales-persons. traders and asset managers will not be able to see the deal."
"The ANSI ID, a Loan Identification Number assigned by the Loan Pricing Corporation to uniquely identify the deal."
"Number between 0 and 100 that represents the difficulty factor for selling the deal, referenced when assigning sales credit."
"The Alternate ID, providing an alternate method of uniquely identifying the deal."

"Indicates if circles for this deal settle ""Actual"" or ""Flat"" during an Interest or Fee period.  ""Actual"": seller receives interest/fees prior to settlement and buyer receives interest/fees after settlement.  ""Flat"": buyer r"
"Indicates whether or not the deal is a ""sole lender deal,"" meaning it has only one contractual circle (the Host Bank Origination Primary)."
The Owning Branch of the deal.

"The deal's grace period, defining the number of days after which an interest or principal payment will be considered ""past due"" for the purpose of assessing a ""default penalty spread"".  (Should not be confused with the General Ledger);
The deal's processing area.
"Indicates whether or not it is ""OK to Fund"" this deal."
The maximum number of active match-funded loans allowed for the deal.
The maximum number of active loans allowed for the deal.
Euro Interim Rounding Precision
The deal classification code.
The projected closing date for the deal.
The date of the Credit Agreement governing the deal.
The deal expense code.
The effective date of the termination.
The deal currency.
The reason why this deal was terminated.  This field is no longer maintained and should be removed from the database.
The deal create assignment code; indicates if assignments can be created in deal.
The deal create participation code; indicates if participations can be created in the deal.
"The SBLC ""Last Issuance By"" Date, after which no new SBLC's can be issued for this deal."
The SBLC Usage Expiration Date (the latest date on which an SBLC for this deal can expire).
The deal status code.
The date the commitment letter was received.
"The effective date of the deal closing (sometimes referred to as the ""Deal Effective Date"")."
"The reason why this deal has been marked ""Not For Sale""."
The effective date of the cancellation of the deal.
The date the deal was approved.
The date the deal was last reviewed.
The User ID of the last reviewer.
The User ID of the Deal Adminstrator specifically assigned to the Deal Team.
The User ID of the originator of the deal.
The User ID of the Relationship Manager specifically assigned to the Deal Team.
Indicates whether or not accounting is enabled.
Indicates whether transactions for this deal will be auto-generated.
Indicates whether transactions for this deal will be auto-released.
contains RID of collateral group each deal belongs to
To store 9-digit deal cusip number
To store 12-digit deal isin number
Indicator whether a deal cusip is listed or not
Indicate whether to charge the Prepayment Penalty Event Fee automaticaly. Default value is 'N'

determines the order in which payments from the borrower should be applied to billed items (i.e. Principal, then interest, then Fees, etc.). If not set at the deal level, the System Parameter value is used.

determines how payments from the borrower should be applied to past due bill items (i.e. start from the oldest bill each in entirety based on the INPAL rule, start from current bill each in entirety based on the INPAL rule, current or oldest paying off all of one category at a time based on INPAL rule)
The cut-off date to add a facility to the deal.
The deal department sub-type code.
N/A
N/A
N/A

Represents the method by which an unscheduled principal payment is applied to the remaining schedule items in a loan re-payment schedule. It can be applied to the last item (LAST), the next item (NEXT), distributed equally among all the remaining items (DISTR) or pro-rated across all the remaining items (PROR). Null will be treated as LAST.

Indicates whether or not the deal is an ABL deal.
Indicates whether or not the deal is eligible for double side posting.

A unique 12-byte Object Id to identify the deal uniquely.
